chapter.title: Tar packages
chapter.para:
Currently a tar.gz package is available for CDK. The package can be found in CVS /cdk/packages/tar. The package can be installed on UNIX type operating systems in a few steps (replace the 20020206 with the latest release date):
$ gunzip cdk-20020206.tar.gz $ tar xvf cdk-20020206.tar $ cd cdk-20020206 $ ./configure && make && install
The package can be downloaded here.

chapter.title: Linux packages
chapter.para: The above package is known to to install on Linux systems. At this moment Linux users should use and install the above tar.gz package, unless they are Debian users. They can use the binary Debian package.

section.title: Debian packages
section.para:
Debian packages are available from debian.wgdd.de. can be build from CVS. The can be apt-geted by adding these lines to your /etc/apt/sources.list file:
deb http://debian.wgdd.de/debian testing main contrib non-free deb-src http://debian.wgdd.de/debian testing main contrib non-free deb http://debian.wgdd.de/debian sarge main contrib non-free deb-src http://debian.wgdd.de/debian sarge main contrib non-free
deb http://debian.wgdd.de/debian unstable main contrib non-free deb-src http://debian.wgdd.de/debian unstable main contrib non-free deb http://debian.wgdd.de/debian sid main contrib non-free deb-src http://debian.wgdd.de/debian sid main contrib non-free
deb http://debian.wgdd.de/debian experimental main contrib non-free deb-src http://debian.wgdd.de/debian experimental main contrib non-free

To build Debian packages, first recompile CDK with "ant dist-all" to make fresh and up to data jar's. Then build the Debian packages in the directory packages/debian. First build libcdkextra which is the Debian package for CDK's cdk-libs tar package. It includes only those jars that are not packaged in other Debian packages. The next package to build is libcdk, which include the CDK jar files. It build-depends on libcdkextra, so you will need to install that one first. The last package to build is the package cdk. These latter two correspond to the CDK tar package cdk-bin. All debian packages are build by typing the following in the appropriate directory:
$ make deb

section.title: RPM packages
section.para: RPM packages are planned but not yet available.

chapter.title: Windows packages
chapter.para:
At this moment there is no Windows packages. Windows users can best download the above tar.gz package which can be unpacked with programs like WinZip. The software can then be compiled with:
ant dist-all
Compilation requires that you have Java3D installed.
